alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 7:45AM CST until February 25 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Mill Creek Near Woodbine affecting Davidson County. For the Mill Creek...including Woodbine...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mill Creek Near Woodbine. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water begins to flood the yards of homes along Wimpole Dr and Currey Rd near Thompson Ln, and the low lying portions of businesses near the intersection of Old Glenrose Ave and Thompson Ln. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 11.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
